moves.2... e5: to be in the center and to open for Q and B
moves.3. Bg2: for good defending and to be ready for O-O
moves.3... d5: to open to the other B and to be in the center
moves.4. d3 h6: to prevent B or N from coming to g5
moves.5. c3 Nf6: developing the other N and preparing for O-O
moves.6. O-O: now his K is in a very safe place
moves.7... exd4: exd4 ! ?? may be advancing to e4 to attack his N better,specially that d4  guarded by Q, N and P
moves.8... Nxd4: attack before being attacked in your home
moves.9. cxd4 O-O 10. a3 Re8: to move R to the half open file
moves.11... b6: to open another way to B
moves.12. Bf4: to be ready for the coming battle
moves.13. Qc1: Q moved to better position attacking in c6 after moving the N and enforcing B to attack the K side !! good move
moves.13... Bf8: to help in case of B and Q attack ! ?
moves.14. b4: advancing in a harry to open to the N the way to advance and to the Q to attack in c6 after that !! good move
moves.14... b5: to block all the mentioned problems
moves.15. Be5: to be in a good position ready to attack
moves.15... Bd6: to exchange a lazy with active
moves.17... Bf5: to develop and to stop the advance
moves.18... Qe6: to fight for controlling the center and to enforce B to attack K side if there will be a chance
moves.19. h3:
advancing to h3 ??? is a big mistake, he put this pawn in a place where it was protected by 1 " B " and attacked by 2 " Q and B "
the chance came very soon, it was a gift
moves.20... Bxg2: to break the strong defense and to attack by Q and N
moves.21... Ng4: to put the N in advanced position
moves.22... Qf6: to attack in f2 after moving his N
to open a way to my N
moves.32. gxh5: gxh5 ?? bad because it give me chance to check by N and Q and to get a good tempo
moves.32... Nxh5: ready to help for check by the Q
moves.33. Nh1: to stop my Q from coming to g3
moves.34. e4:
e4 ?? advanced to be in the center protected by 2 rocks, bad move.
it gave my N the chance to jump to f4 forking his K and his R
moves.34... Nf4+: Nf4+ !! good move protected by Q
moves.36. Rxe2: forced, but may be with the Q better
moves.36... Reh6: Reh6 !! good move, attacking his N
moves.37. e5:
e5 ??? big mistake
attacking my Q in the wrong time
moves.40... Qh6: to save the Q and put it in a good position
moves.42... Qg6+: trying to find a way to trap the K or exchange R by Q or even Q by Q
moves.43. Ke3 Qf5: Q is getting closer to the K
moves.44... Rh3: R is in a good position attacking f3 with the Q
moves.45... g4: g4 !!! attacking the pawn in f3 good move, 3 attackers 2 defenders one of them the K and it is pinned by R
moves.46... Qxf3+: to force exchange the queens plus getting a pawn
moves.47... Rxf3+:
by the R !! good move to force the K to go back and to open the way to my K and pawns to advance.
at this position he resigned.
 conclusion :

    have done and may be the beginners will learn some thing.
